Half-Life 2 is a must play for those getting into PC gaming. Although it hasn't stood the tests of time all too well, it still proves to be a fun experiance and features such as non-regenerating health and the abbility to carry dozens of guns takes players back to the good ol' days of proper level design and careful balance. The game feels like a fun roller-coaster as it takes your through it's carefully scripted champeign without ever taking control away from you. The story may be admitidly short but it offers some replayability as you often do not notice or pay attention to all of the fun details the first time through.

Outdated in most ways, this game has a glimmer of gold amongst the ugly shades of gray. 
Despite its interesting setting, the game has a lack a place. After a hectic beginning, you are made to wander through grimy sewers for hours on end. The vehicle sections, while fun, seem out of place. They do, however add a welcome new element. This is something in which Half-Life is sorely lacking.
I'm sure its nostalgia-value is through the roofs. For a newcomer, however, it is a dull (albeit narratively interesting) ride.
best game ever

Vorrei fare questa recensione in italiano per provare a far piacere e magari a far amare, come è successo a me, questo fantastico titolo a tutti i videogiocatori italiani che magari si trovano in difficoltà con lingue straniere o termini complicati. Premetto che non sono nè uno scrittore nè un giornalista: cerco solo di essere d'aiuto e perdonatemi se vedete errori o cose scritte male.
Non vi spaventate se nella descrizione vedete strane date: Half Life, 1998; Half Life 2, 2004.. Anche se datati, questi due prodotti sono più che validi, soprattutto il secondo.
Half Life 2 è uno sparatutto in prima persona prodotto da Valve che utilizza il SOURCE Engine come motore grafico: questo lo rende molto fluido e adatto a qualsiasi modello o tipo di computer. Valve, famosa per titoli quali Counter Strike, Portal e il più recente DOTA 2, dopo aver riscontrato un notevole successo con Half Life, ha deciso di produrre un seguito, migliorandolo e portandolo a livelli inimmaginabili per quegli anni.
Half Life 2 presenta una trama coinvolgente e intrigante, che ti costringerà a non staccarti dalla sedia e a dover rigiocarlo più e più volte, magari per rivivere alcune emozioni. Ogni personaggio è uno più carismatico dell'altro e li amerete tutti quanti.
Con un doppiaggio eccezionale e una colonna sonora da Oscar, la qualità audio è fantastica.
Con un gameplay fluido, comodo e semplice per voi sarà difficile trovarvi in difficoltà con i tasti.
Le ambientazioni futuristiche di City 17, i pesaggi sconfinati della costa e la spaventosa Ravenholm vi faranno apprezzare il lavoro che è stato svolto dagli sviluppatori.
Che dire di più? Questo è un eccezionale gioco che ogni persona dovrebbe provare almeno una volta. Per la qualità, ma soprattutto per il prezzo!
Grazie a tutti per aver letto, BELLA!
This is a classic. If you haven't played HL and HL 2 and you're a gamer, you owe it to yourself to play this game.

Is so much more than a game, because you end up forgetting it's a game! HL2 is not just about mindless shooting and killing... VALVe offers you one of the most diverse gameplay: each chapter has its own mechanics and new weapons, real NEW weapons: they're not just more powerful, they're really different (as the gravity gun). The story is great and very immersing: you know who you are, what you must do and why you do it... It isn't like: "Hey! that's the story! keep doing whatever you were doing! (mindless killing in most cases)". The AI isn't great, that's agreed, but it's somehow acceptable because it's not at the center of the game. The graphics are getting old too but it's very well done (I still play the first Half-Life: it doesn't matter) and the physics are still great, actually it's really the only game where you have a real interactivity with the physics.
Jesus decidedto make a video game. He also decided to throw a curveball and make it pretty hard.

After having replayed the game on PC (rather than X360) in 2013 I have to say it's better than the Xbox 360 version with regards to the graphics and controls, but the core gameplay is still very much stuck in the 90s. The basic game mechanics are so outdated and unimmersive it's difficult to take it seriously. Small things like meleeing enemies with the crowbar and mounting turrets as well as primitive controls and movement make it seem really amateur for the standards of today. The one thing that makes this game stand out is the level design. The levels aren't only long and adventurous but they manage to cram in so much variety with so few tools and gimmicks. The use of the physics engine as well as the famous gravity gun is particularly commendable. However, the shooting has no weighty feel to it, and weapons don't have any recoil. Enemies take damage with no seeming impact until they die. The characters are almost non-existent because the game's lack of cutscenes prevents any real development in the story. At every point when you play Half-Life 2, you feel like you're using compiled C code rather than playing a video game. It just feels like software that's made for a specific purpose. Although the voice acting, lip-syncing and attention to detail in the environments are all top notch, the main gameplay of Half-Life 2 is just plain bland and boring despite the varied levels. It's definitely an overrated game.

Half-Life² ist mit der Beste Egoshoter den ich kenne weil es nicht nur um ständiges geballere geht sondern Rätsel lösen und das ist das besondere von Half-Life². Ich finde das Valve zwei dinge zu eins verschmolzen hat Egoshooter und Denkspiel in einem. Zudem kann man viel mit der Physik spielen, man kann gegner mit Toiletten abwerfen oder mit ihren eigenen Waffen schlagen z.B. Granaten.Valve hat Half-Life seit dem 1 Teil sehr verbessert vorallem die Grafik.Aber man muss dazu sagen das zwischen 1998 und 2004 schon etwas zeit liegt.Trotzdem ist die Grafik für das Spiel für diese Zeit schon Revolutionär gewesen.Mein Fazit wer nicht nur Herumgeballere haben will wie bei vielen Egoshooter sondern auch mal nen paar Denkaufgaben der sollte sich Half-Life² holen für 8,99€ und ca.16std Spiel und Denkspaß ist das ein echtes Schnäppchen :D Viel Spaß beim zocken und wenn ihr lust habt und gerade beigeisterter Half-Life Fan geworden seit Joint doch mal meine Half-Life Fan Gruppe http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Half-Life-Community.

Valve's premier shooter seems to be showing its age. It opens solidly enough, and the Source engine at the time relishes the lovely looking water, but often-finicky physics puzzles and that unwieldy Classic FPS nature of non-regenerating health means you'll die all too often, and the reloads feel clunky and slow.
Definitely worth a go, but it does slow down.

Half life 2 is one of a very few shining gems out there, it brings linear, and merges it with non linear somehow, it immerses you in the shoes of Gordon Freeman even though you know almost nothing about him, it also was the first to use physics puzzels, which is a huge accomplishment considering it was only made in 2004 when polygon figures were still big and chunky, and it is quite a lengthy campaign, with awesome characters and gameplay, I would recommend watching some gameplay first, because the style may not appeal to everyone.

I remember waiting for this game for so long. Never have my expectations ever been so high for a game, and never has a game exceeded such high expectations quite like Valve's masterpiece. It was/is that good. The release of Half-Life 2 will forever be a monumental moment in video game history, and it'll always have a special place in my heart. I might die never having played a better game.

I was late to the party with Half Life 2. A few years ago I decided to play through both Half Life 1 & Half Life 2. When I reached the ending of Half Life 1 and started the second one I was blown away. I knew immediately that this was something special.

Valve has a unique sensibility to story telling and level design. They feel like the Pixar of the video game world. They know what captures your imagination and how to fulfill it. The Citadel is the perfect example of this. When you emerge into City 17 you see a giant alien skyscrapper in the distance. What was my first thought? I want inside that building. Do you get to go there... yup.

In Half Life, you aren't just playing a series of levels slapped together. You are progressing through a convincingly distopian world where you are the hero. The characters you interact with show true emotion and you want to help them.

As if all this wasn't good enough, Valve created a port of Half Life 2 for the Oculus Rift earlier this year. Playing Half Life in the Oculus is an experience to not be forgotten. You get a whole new understanding of the craftmanship that went into each model design. You see the whirring gears in the flying cameras!

This game is a masterpiece and a landmark in video game history. If for some reason you haven't played it, buy it. If you can afford an Oculus Rift, get that too. You won't regret it.
I wasn't a fan of the first one, but this was, even today, is damn awesome. The sheer size and scope of the game is certainly impressive and begs for a second playthrough.

Absolutely beautiful. I'll be honest; I put off playing it (or more accurately, beating it) for a long while, but I'm glad I finally did.
It's a very immersive enviroment and I loved the wide array of weapons at your disposal. Also, in case you weren't aware, this is one of the most acclaimed (and circle-jerked) games of all time, and for good reason. Everything about it just felt right: the movement, the characters and dialogue, the weapons, everything. 

There were a few points where I got confused as to what to do and (shame on me) had to look up what to do, but in all cases it was simply due to my own confusion/ignorance, not bad design.

My rating: TEN-OUTTA-TEN!

[b][u]Игра десятилетия[/u][/b]...Потрясающая графика...Шикарный геймплей...Вдохновляющая музыка...и Мурашки по телу и Слёзы на глазах...[b][u]Half-Life[/u][/b] покорила миллионов игроков всего мира...всего человечества...и покорила их сердца...она, как Муза для писателя...как Арфа для музыканта...всегда приятна и мила...Я горжусь этой замечательной игрой...горжусь создателями этой игры...мои любимые [b][u]Valve[/u][/b]... дорогой [b][u]Гейб Нюэлл[/u][/b]...Спасибо Вам за всё...Вы дали нам возможность задуматься над тем, что нас озадачивала жизнь...и в итоге Мы нашли Ответ...именно в этой игре...Не бросай никого в беде...Помогай ближнему своему...люби того, кого требует любить твоё сердце...и кого ты должен знать всегда и везде...[b][u]Ты всегда с нами Half-Life[/u][/b]...мы тебя никуда не пустим, будем тебя оберегать и хранить, пока наши внуки будут расти...и потом они начнут вступаться за тебя горой...мы ждём ещё одного малыша...который прольёт на свет божий ещё одно Великое творение компании Valve...[b][u]Half-Life 3[/u][/b]...И я..от всех Фанатов Half-Life хочу выразить этой игре ОСОБУЮ и ВЕЛИЧЕСТВЕННУЮ [b][u]Благодарность[/u][/b] за всё, что она нам подарила! Half life 2 es un juego de acción en primera persona de Valve lanzado en 2004. Fue premiado como juego de la década en los VGA Awards. El premio lo recibió Gabe Newell, fundador de Valve.

El juego transcurre 20 años después del incidente de Black Mesa del Half Life ( El juego que recuerdo con mayor cariño de los que he jugado). Gordon Freeman despierta de su hibernación en Ciudad 17 donde forma parte de la resistencia para enfrentarse al imperio Combine e intentar derrotarlo. En el juego Gordon conoce a Alyx Vance quien forma parte de la resistencia. El juego es uno de los pioneros en introducir un compañero de juego.

Half Life 2 presenta diferentes enemigos. Los Headcrabs siguen produciendo esa sensación de rechazo característica cuando atacan. La acción es vertiginosa pero tiene pausas, no como juegos del tipo Call of Duty donde uno se la pasa disparando sin respirar. 

La narrativa se implementa a lo largo del videojuego, no es contada con grabadores o notas, no es necesario, la experiencia es brillante. El motor Source permite buen manejo de físicas y la introducción de un arma nueva. El cañón de gravedad. La tecnología permite además espacios abiertos en el exterior además de los tradicionales pasadizos y espacios internos.  

Su manejo de la narrativa, la física y los puzzles cambiaron la forma en que se desarrollaron los siguientes juegos en primera persona. Fue un punto de inflexión en los juegos de la misma forma que  lo fue el primer Half Life. 

El juego se lanzó para PC bajo windows, requería un procesador de 2 Ghz. 512 MB de ram y una tarjeta gráfica compatible con Direct X 8.1.  Por los pocos recursos que pedía en ese momento la calidad gráfica del juego era muy buena y corria en forma muy fluida. 

Este es uno de los juegos que debe ser jugado si uno se toma en serio ser un Gamer, no solo por su calidad sino por formar parte de la historia de los videojuegos.

Epic story line and the puzzle solving is epic. The source engine is great and the physics changed how games are now produced. At the time of release, this game was astonishing! Some games have surpassed Half-life 2 graphically but the story and gameplay could only ever be bested by another Half-Life game. You shouldn't even need to read reviews to know how incredible Half-Life 2 is. In fact, I'm not even sure how some people don't own this masterpiece. For the price that it is, it's probably the best purchase you could possibly make. If you don't own this game yet, crack out your credit card and get playing becuase trust me,  you're missing out. This game is perfect in every aspect. I give it a 25 out of 10.

I don't think anyone really needs to read my drip of a review in the already thriving ocean of love that Half-Life is swimming in, but I'm bored, and you're here.

Half-Life 2 improves upon Valve's amazing storytelling sans-cutscenes and through environmental cues and wonderful voice acting in its NPCs. You are still Gordon Freeman and still as silent as ever, soaking it all in. Some say that he is an empty husk devoid of character, while others treat his silence as an opportunity to let themselves react to the events in the world around them rather than being told how Gordon feels; YOU are Gordon Freeman.

The Source engine was debuted in HL2 and there are many little physics 'puzzles', to use the word generously, that show off the engine's bells and whistles. The gravity gun is really where it shines though.
The AI is competent (any veteran FPS player will have to play on the hardest difficulty setting), and there are many wonderful action set-pieces in well-fleshed out locales.

That's about all I can say here; I may share my thoughts on Episodes 1 and 2 at a later date.
Until then, happy headcrab hunting.

This game was my first actual m-rated game.  And there was no better introduction into what adult games could do.  The graphics and gameplay are...dated for sure, but the atmosphere is the absolute best.  You can feel the oppression the alien leaders radiate.  They control and enslave the entirety of The Earth, and you run from them for the majority of the game.  You feel like you are fighting against something more powerful than you can even imagine, and even when you start to fight back, you know that you have no idea how gigantic your enemies are.  The trailers have a 1984 influence, and the games do more subtly. There are subconscious messages hidden throughout the game that lead to an over-all eerie atmosphere while you play.  Sure, there are jump-scares (some well-timed enough to catch me), but the enemies are more psychological.  This will be the most perfect game I've ever played.
I think that Half-Life 2 is one of the best games best ever. It has some of the best storytelling ever.

I think Half Life 2 is quite overated... I think it was fun, but no where near as hyped. Everyone always says the graphics and story are great, and I know its an old game but the graphics are meh and the story I just don't really like. It was good and I do enjoy but I enjoyed it for say 10 minutes, then it took another 30 until I got into it again... The only thing keeping me playing this is my friend bugging me and the mystery of G-Man. I'm afraid I give this game a 4/10.

This is a review for HL2 and all the episodes.

The series progressively gets better as you play through the episodes(E2>E1>HL2.) HL2 was forgettable and not really that interesting. HL2 EP1 had some nice points but you could tell the story was getting to the point where it's about to get really good. HL2 EP2, the story is finally what I would consider "good", pretty intense cliffhanger. Overall HL2 is a fun fps with some great high points and a decent story but it doesn't deserve all the hype surrounding HL3. Great gameplay mechanics and maybe too many physics puzzles involving seesaws.

Half-Life 2 is without a doubt one of the greatest games I have ever played in my life. I have no problem saying that it is my number one favorite. Even today, the physics engine is extraordinary and is still being used in games today. An entire generation of game making, mod making, and even short films was all born from this one game, and that still blows my mind.

The story is just as intense as a Hollywood movie. You care about the characters and you really want to help your allies and strike down your enemies. It is an incredibly immersive experience. Story wise, the entire Half-Life franchise (especially this installment) make it the best video game franchise in history. Despite what some people say, this game has aged incredibly well. There will be more games in the future, some incredible and some horrible. Maybe the magic of Half-Life 2 will be matched, but I personally believe it will never be exceeded.

I loved this game in every respect. Gameplay, graphics, and story is all 10/10.

Half Life 2 is a spectacular game, but you probably already know that. Although it was originally released almost a decade ago, it still stands as one of the greatest PC games of all time. You play as Gordon Freeman, a silent scientist fighting against an extra-dimensional empire that has conquered earth.

Gameplay is fun and engaging, and rarely ever feels monotonous. Whenever the game starts to feel boring, it will introduce something totally new, keeping the game from becoming repetitive. You have a variety of different guns and weapons at your disposal, including the powerful Gravity Gun that lets you weaponize the environment. Valve's Source engine was created for this game, and they used it well to create an interactive environment for you to explore. You'll run into the occasional physics puzzle that helps keep the game interesting.

The story is intriguing and makes you really care about the characters and what is happening. It also doesn't waste too much time forcing exposition down your throat with long cutscenes. Speaking of the cutscenes, there really aren't any. When characters are talking to you, you are free to walk around and interact with things. This may not seem like a big deal, but it really makes the game feel so much more immersive.

There are a handful of things that I don't particularly like about Half Life 2, but they are fairly nit-picky things that really don't detract too much from the game. For instance, I'm not a huge fan of the lack of ADS, which has since then become a standard for FPS games. However, it isn't a huge deal, and aiming with the crosshairs works fine. Also, the driving parts of the game are a little too long for my taste, but it isn't a huge deal.

Overall, this is a spectacular game, a must-play for any PC gamer.

Even though the game was released over 9 years ago, it still holds up. Great story, great characters and character animation. Contains differing environments and plenty of weapons and enemies to keep the game fresh throughout. The dated visuals are still very, very charming. Even if you buy it and never play it, you will still spend your money wisely because just having the game in your library is worth the $10. I first played it waaaay back in 2007 as part of the Orange Box on Xbox 360. Good then, and still good now.

I can't truly explain why I love this game as much as I do, but to me, it is a work of art. The graphics are outdated for sure, but they work together in a way that negates any low resolution! I love the story. There is little exposition, and you're really thrown into a world that doesn't give a shit if you pay attention to it or not. 
There are countless little details you can find with each new playthrough, and they all make the game feel so much more alive! Physics puzzels can get annoying at times, and I don't recommend stacking barrels to ANYONE who wants to retain their sanity, but the atmosphere and story more than make up for it. 

The people ingame feel like real people, even though only about 5-6 of them are really CHARACTERS. The generic people in the world still feel like people, and they say people things, they DO people things! Only a stupid physics puzzle has ever broken my immersion in this game. I love it, and I do believe about half the internet agrees with me.

Si ya tienes Half-Life y te ha gustado no puedes perderte este juego y sus dos (esperemos que pronto sean tres) secuelas, con un nuevo motor gráfico y nuevas armas. Recomiendo cogerlo con el pack The Orange Box, o con Half-Life Complete si te ha enganchado su historia.
Awesome
Das Spiel zeigt, dass auch lineare Shooter gut sein können.
its a great game with the best story line.
GABEN YOU FUCK, RELEASE EPISODE 3.

Melhor que Half-Life? Só o Half-Life 2. Amei cada minuto que passei jogando,e ainda fico encantada com a história épica desse jogo. Os gráficos da engine Source (que foi uma revolução no mundo dos games na época do lançamento) e a física do jogo são impecáveis e, se você estiver jogando pela primeira vez, vai ficar maravilhado com tantos detalhes tanto no cenário quanto na história. A adição da Gravity Gun e da possibilidade de usar alguns veículos ganhou ainda mais pontos comigo.
Half-Life 2 is what makes a gamer life complete!
This games story is EPIC! nuff said.
